units.title: Cortical organoid differentiation setup
units.text: Cells were dissociated from human cortical tissue as described above. Fifty thousand cell aliquots were reconstituted in 200 μl CUT&Tag wash buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche)). Nuclei were isolated by resuspending cell pellets in 200 μl dig‑wash buffer and washed twice in 200 μl dig‑wash buffer before resuspension in 100 μl dig‑wash buffer supplemented with 2 mM EDTA and a 1:50 dilution of H3K27ac primary antibody (Cell Signaling 8173), and incubated overnight at 4 °C on an overhead rotary shaker rotating at 90 rpm, and changed to Dulbecco’s modified Eagle’s medium (DMEM)/F12‑based medium containing 1× glutamax, 1× N2, 1× B27 without vitamin A and 1× antibiotic–antimycotic (anti‑anti).
units.rationale: Describes the initial cell preparation and medium conditions for organoid differentiation.

units.title: Organoid culture conditions post‑day 35
units.text: At day 35, organoids from each line were split into three different conditions: 1) normal medium conditions for day 35 and beyond as described above (with vitamin A); 2) normal medium conditions for day 35 and beyond (with vitamin A) plus 100 μM DEAB, an inhibitor of RA synthesis; or 3) normal medium conditions for day 35 and beyond as described above using B27 without vitamin A. DEAB treatment was ended after one week, and culture conditions remained the same until day 70, at which time organoids were processed for scRNA‑seq and immunohistochemistry.
units.rationale: Specifies the experimental treatment groups and timeline for organoid culture.

units.title: Single‑cell RNA‑seq library preparation
units.text: Single‑cell RNA‑seq libraries were generated using the 10X Genomics Chromium 3′ Gene Expression Kit. In brief, single cells were loaded onto chromium chips with a capture target of 10,000 cells per sample. Libraries were prepared following the provided protocol and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq with a targeted sequencing depth of 50,000 reads per cell.
units.rationale: Provides the core steps for generating scRNA‑seq libraries from organoid cells.

units.title: Bulk ATAC‑seq library preparation
units.text: Bulk ATAC‑seq libraries were generated as described57. In brief, 50,000 nuclei were permeabilized and tagmented. Tagmented chromatin libraries were generated and sequenced on an Illumina NovaSeq with a target sequencing depth of 50 million reads per library.
units.rationale: Outlines the procedure for preparing bulk ATAC‑seq libraries from nuclei.

units.title: H3K27ac CUT&Tag library preparation
units.text: Fifty thousand cell aliquots were reconstituted in 200 μl CUT&Tag wash buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche)). Nuclei were isolated by resuspending cell pellets in 200 μl dig‑wash buffer and washed twice in 200 μl dig‑wash buffer before resuspension in 100 μl dig‑wash buffer supplemented with 2 mM EDTA and a 1:50 dilution of H3K27ac primary antibody (Cell Signaling 8173), and incubated overnight at 4 °C on an overhead rotary shaker rotating at 90 rpm. After washing, pA‑Tn5 was added at a dilution of 1:100 in 100 μl dig‑med buffer and incubated for 1 h at 37 °C. DNA was purified with a 1.5:1 ratio of AMPure XP beads, eluted in 21 μl buffer EB, and libraries were amplified with 12 cycles of PCR (98 °C 10 s, 63 °C 30 s, 72 °C 1 min) before purification and sequencing.
units.rationale: Details the CUT&Tag workflow for profiling H3K27ac modifications.

units.title: Nucleus isolation from fresh primary tissue
units.text: Nucleus isolation from fresh primary tissue described above except using B27 without vitamin A. DEAB treatment was ended after one week, and culture conditions remained the same until day 70, at which time organoids were processed for scRNA‑seq and immunohistochemistry.
units.rationale: Specifies a variant of nucleus isolation tailored for DEAB‑treated samples.

units.title: Immunohistochemistry sample preparation
units.text: Samples used for immunostaining were fixed in 4% PFA for 45 min, washed out with PBS, and incubated overnight in a 30% sucrose solution at 4 °C. Samples were then embedded in a 1:1 solution of OCT and sucrose and frozen at −80 °C until ready for sectioning. Cryosections were prepared at a thickness of 16 μm. Heat‑induced antigen retrieval was performed in 10 mM sodium citrate (pH 6.0) for 15 min. Permeabilization was performed in PBS (pH 7.4) supplemented with 2% Triton X‑100. Primary and secondary antibodies were diluted and incubated in PBS (pH 7.4) supplemented with 10% donkey serum, 2% Triton X‑100, 0.2% gelatin.
units.rationale: Provides the step‑by‑step protocol for preparing organoid sections for immunostaining.

units.title: Single‑cell ATAC‑seq library preparation
units.text: Nuclei were prepared as outlined in the 10X Genomics single‑cell ATAC‑seq solution protocol (v1.0 kit was used). Nuclei were loaded with a capture target of 10,000 nuclei per sample. scATAC‑seq libraries were prepared for sequencing following the 10X Genomics single‑cell ATAC‑seq solution protocol. Sequenced using PE150 on an Illumina NovaSeq with a target depth of 25,000 reads per nucleus.
units.rationale: Summarizes the workflow for generating single‑cell ATAC‑seq libraries.

units.title: Bulk H3K27ac CUT&Tag library preparation
units.text: Bulk H3K27ac CUT&Tag libraries were prepared as previously described60, with modifications. In brief, cells were dissociated from human cortical tissue as described above. Fifty thousand cell aliquots were reconstituted in 200 μl CUT&Tag wash buffer (20 mM HEPES pH 7.5, 150 mM NaCl, 0.5 mM spermidine, 1× protease inhibitor cocktail (Roche)). Nuclei were isolated by resuspending cell pellets in 200 μl dig‑wash buffer and washed twice in 200 μl dig‑wash buffer before resuspension in 100 μl dig‑wash buffer supplemented with 2 mM EDTA and a 1:50 dilution of H3K27ac primary antibody (Cell Signaling 8173), and incubated overnight at 4 °C on an overhead rotary shaker rotating at 90 rpm. pA‑Tn5 was added at a dilution of 1:100 in 100 μl dig‑med buffer and incubated for 1 h at 37 °C. DNA was purified with AMPure XP beads, eluted in 21 μl buffer EB, and libraries were amplified with 12 PCR cycles before sequencing on an Illumina NovaSeq to a depth of 15 million reads per library.
units.rationale: Describes the bulk CUT&Tag protocol for profiling H3K27ac across many cells.
